# 2. Matrices
---
# Matrix operations

Create a matrix


```r
x <- matrix(1:6, ncol=3); x
```

```
##      [,1] [,2] [,3]
## [1,]    1    3    5
## [2,]    2    4    6
```

Select a row/column


```r
x[1, ] # select the 1st row
```

```
## [1] 1 3 5
```



```r
x[, 1] # select the 1st column
```

```
## [1] 1 2
```

Select an element


```r
x[2, 3]
```

```
## [1] 6
```
---

# Matrix operations (cont.)

Transpose


```r
t(x)
```

```
##      [,1] [,2]
## [1,]    1    2
## [2,]    3    4
## [3,]    5    6
```

Matrix multiplication


```r
y <- matrix(seq(10, 60, by=10), nrow=3)
z <- x %*% y
z
```

```
##      [,1] [,2]
## [1,]  220  490
## [2,]  280  640
```

Find x in: m*x=n

```r
solve(m, n)
```

# 3. Data Frames

# Create a data frame

### Create your own dataframe


```r
sta <- data.frame(id=101:103, marks = c(90, 80, 60), grade=c("A+", "A", "C"))
sta
```

```
##    id marks grade
## 1 101    90    A+
## 2 102    80     A
## 3 103    60     C
```

### Built-in dataframes


```r
data(iris)
```
